unnormalised: RBI just announced new guidelines for linking your Aadhaar no. with your bank a/c. Starting 10/11/2024, KYC will be mandatory for all existing and new customers. You'll need to provide either your PAN card or Form 60 if you don't have a PAN. This move aims to curb fraudulent activities and ensure better transparency.
normalised: R-B-I just announced new guidelines for linking your Aadhaar number with your bank account. Starting tenth november two thousand and twenty four, K-Y-C will be mandatory for all existing and new customers. You'll need to provide either your P-A-N card or Form sixty if you don't have a P-A-N. This move aims to curb fraudulent activities and ensure better transparency.

unnormalised: Apparently, many folks are confused about the process. Don't worry, your bank's branch or their website will guide you. Keep your CIF number handy, as it might be needed. Remember, linking your accounts before the deadline – 31/12/2024 – is crucial to avoid any disruptions to your banking services.

unnormalised: And a little birdie told me that the RBI is also considering implementing a unique customer identifier – UCI – system wide, so each customer gets a 12-digit number to link all accounts across different banks. No official announcement yet, but sources say it's likely to be rolled out in Q1 2025. Stay tuned for more updates!
